headline: Super Micro shares skyrocket after naming new auditor
summary: Investing.com-- Shares of Super Micro Computer Inc (NASDAQ:SMCI) rose sharply in evening deals on Monday after it named BDO USA as its auditor and said it had submitted a plan to the Nasdaq seeking more time to comply with listing rules.

headline: Super Micro Stock Jumps as It Files Plan With Nasdaq to Stay Listed
summary: Super Micro Computer  has appointed an independent auditor and submitted a plan with Nasdaq to comply with listing requirements.  Super Micro  stock closed 15.9% higher to $21.54 and shot up another 28% in after-hours trading.  In a statement, Super Micro said its board engaged BDO USA, P.C. as its auditor, effective immediately.

raw.headline: Super Micro Stock Jumps as It Files Plan With Nasdaq to Stay Listed

Super Micro  stock closed 15.9% higher to $21.54 and shot up another 28% in after-hours trading.  In a statement, Super Micro said its board engaged BDO USA, P.C. as its auditor, effective immediately.

summary: The server maker said it believes it will be able to complete its annual report on Form 10-K within the discretionary period available to the Nasdaq staff to grant.

headline: Supermicro Stock Soars on Plan To Avoid Delisting
summary: Super Micro Computer shares soared Monday after the server maker named a new auditor and filed a compliance plan to avoid delisting by the Nasdaq amid speculation about its accounting practices.

raw.headline: Supermicro Stock Soars on Plan To Avoid Delisting

headline: Super Micro Computer names BDO as auditor, files Nasdaq compliance plan
summary: In the compliance plan, the AI server maker said it will be able to complete its annual report for the year ended June 30 and its quarterly report ended Sept. 30, but did not give a target date.  Super Micro's listing came under threat after it failed to file its annual 10-K report by the August deadline, citing a need to assess "its internal controls over financial reporting" for the delay.

headline: Supermicro Announces Appointment of BDO USA as Independent Auditor and Filing of Compliance Plan with Nasdaq
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., November 18, 2024--Super Micro Computer, Inc. (Nasdaq: SMCI), a Total IT Solution Provider for AI, Cloud, Storage, and 5G/Edge, announced today that the Audit Committee of its Board of Directors has engaged BDO USA, P.C. ("BDO") as its independent auditor, effective immediately. BDO is a member firm of BDO International, one of the world’s top five accounting firms network with over 115,000 professionals across its global network and a recognized leader in audit and assurance.

raw.headline: Supermicro Announces Appointment of BDO USA as Independent Auditor and Filing of Compliance Plan with Nasdaq

(Nasdaq: SMCI), a Total IT Solution Provider for AI, Cloud, Storage, and 5G/Edge, announced today that the Audit Committee of its Board of Directors has engaged BDO USA, P.C. ("BDO") as its independent auditor, effective immediately. BDO is a member firm of BDO International, one of the world’s top five accounting firms network with over 115,000 professionals across its global network and a recognized leader in audit and assurance.

summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) shares soar after a report that the company will release a plan to avoid being delisted. Market Domination Hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton outline what investors need to know as the market waits for Super Micro to announce a plan to complete the filing. headline: Why Super Micro Computer Stock Was Soaring Today
summary: Shares of Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) were surging today as investors awaited a plan from the company to stay in compliance with the Nasdaq and maintain its listing.  Following a delay in its 10-K filing, the Nasdaq told Supermicro in September that it was out of compliance with its standards and that it had two months to file the annual report or submit a plan to get back in compliance.  At this point, today's jump is just one small chapter in the larger drama around Supermicro, as the stock is still 60% from its peak before Hindenburg Research released a short report on the company, accusing it of accounting problems, which preceded its delay in filing its 10-K report.

raw.headline: Why Super Micro Computer Stock Was Soaring Today
raw.summary: Shares of Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) were surging today as investors awaited a plan from the company to stay in compliance with the Nasdaq and maintain its listing. At this point, today's jump is just one small chapter in the larger drama around Supermicro, as the stock is still 60% from its peak before Hindenburg Research released a short report on the company, accusing it of accounting problems, which preceded its delay in filing its 10-K report.

headline: Super Micro Computer Stock Is Rebounding Today. Is It Time to Buy?
summary: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) stock has been in free fall for the last six months.  A myriad of issues related to its accounting practices have spooked investors.  After the company announced it would have to delay the release of its 10-K annual report for its fiscal 2024 ended June 30, it also faced the possibility of its stock being delisted from the Nasdaq Stock Exchange.

headline: Heard on the Street: Nvidia Overheating Report Unlikely to Cool AI Server Demand
summary: Nvidia’s newest artificial intelligence systems may or may not have an overheating issue.  Nvidia’s stock slipped more than 3% after the opening bell following a report over the weekend by The Information that the company is still tweaking the design of one of its newest systems to prevent overheating.  In the meantime, Dell, Super Micro and Hewlett Packard Enterprise--all of whom make servers using Nvidia’s chips--all made strong gains in morning trades.

headline: Super Micro Stock Rises as Filing to Avoid Delisting Is Awaited
summary: Super Micro Computer was rising sharply Monday as investors awaited a planned filing that might allow the server maker to avoid being delisted.  Super Micro  shares were up 19% to $22.14 and were on track for their largest daily percentage increase since February, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Super Micro also delayed the filing of its quarterly 10-Q last week.

Super Micro also delayed the filing of its quarterly 10-Q last week.

headline: The S&P 500 Turns Higher. Super Micro and Tesla Are Leading the Charge.
summary: The Dow was down 72 points, or 0.2%, as some of its largest stocks by weight like Goldman Sachs and UnitedHealth Group were on the decline.  The Nasdaq Composite was up 0.8%.  "Traders appear to be gauging the potential impact of a new Trump administration’s policies on the economy, and the possibility that the Fed may slow down its rate-cutting campaign," writes Chris Larkin, managing director, trading and investing at E*TRADE from Morgan Stanley.

headline: Super Micro Computer, T-Mobile, Samsung: 3 Stocks in Focus
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) must submit its delayed 10-K filing to the Securities and Exchange Commission to avoid being delisted. T-Mobile (TMUS) was reported among several telecommunications companies to be hacked by Chinese intelligence agencies, according to The Wall Street Journal. Samsung (005930.KS) shares gain after the company announced a $7 billion buyback over the course of the next year.
